name: Path T Vagina
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension detail are available, record the code with extension detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. FIGO Stage III is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  

**Note 2:**    FIGO does not include an in situ category for tumors of the vagina, but TNM does. Assign pTis (behavior code /2) for in situ cases. 

**Note 3:** The presence of bullous edema is not sufficient evidence to classify a tumor as T4.

**Note 3:**  The pelvic wall is defined as muscle, fascia, neurovascular structures, or skeletal portions of the bony pelvis.
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record

Invasive cancer confined to: 
    Submucosa (stroma) (vagina)

Musculature involved

Localized, NOS

FIGO Stage I

Stated as T1

Cervix
Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
Paravaginal soft tissue
Rectovaginal septum
Vesicovaginal septum
Vulva

FIGO Stage II

Stated as T2

Extension to: 
   Bladder wall or bladder, NOS excluding mucosa
   Pelvic wall (described clinically as frozen pelvis)
   Rectal wall or rectum, NOS excluding mucosa

Stated as T3

Tumor invades mucosa of bladder or rectum, OR 

Extends beyond the true pelvis

Extension to:  
    Bladder mucosa (excluding bullous edema)
    Rectal mucosa
    Urethra

FIGO Stage IVA

Stated as T4
Pathologic T is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
